speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: SCENE II. Before LEONTES' palace.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Enter AUTOLYCUS and a Gentleman

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Beseech you, sir, were you present at this relation?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I was by at the opening of the fardel, heard the old

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: shepherd deliver the manner how he found it:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: whereupon, after a little amazedness, we were all

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: commanded out of the chamber; only this methought I

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: heard the shepherd say, he found the child.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: I would most gladly know the issue of it.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: I make a broken delivery of the business; but the

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: changes I perceived in the king and Camillo were

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: very notes of admiration: they seemed almost, with

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: staring on one another, to tear the cases of their

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: eyes; there was speech in their dumbness, language

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: in their very gesture; they looked as they had heard

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: of a world ransomed, or one destroyed: a notable

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: passion of wonder appeared in them; but the wisest

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: beholder, that knew no more but seeing, could not

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: say if the importance were joy or sorrow; but in the

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: extremity of the one, it must needs be.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Enter another Gentleman

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Here comes a gentleman that haply knows more.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The news, Rogero?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Nothing but bonfires: the oracle is fulfilled; the

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: king's daughter is found: such a deal of wonder is

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: broken out within this hour that ballad-makers

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: cannot be able to express it.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Enter a third Gentleman

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: Here comes the Lady Paulina's steward: he can

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: deliver you more. How goes it now, sir? this news

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: which is called true is so like an old tale, that

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: the verity of it is in strong suspicion: has the king

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: found his heir?

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Most true, if ever truth were pregnant by

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: circumstance: that which you hear you'll swear you

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: see, there is such unity in the proofs. The mantle

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: of Queen Hermione's, her jewel about the neck of it,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: the letters of Antigonus found with it which they

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: know to be his character, the majesty of the

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: creature in resemblance of the mother, the affection

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: of nobleness which nature shows above her breeding,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: and many other evidences proclaim her with all

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: certainty to be the king's daughter. Did you see

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: the meeting of the two kings?

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: No.

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Then have you lost a sight, which was to be seen,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: cannot be spoken of. There might you have beheld one

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: joy crown another, so and in such manner that it

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: seemed sorrow wept to take leave of them, for their

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: joy waded in tears. There was casting up of eyes,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: holding up of hands, with countenances of such

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: distraction that they were to be known by garment,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: not by favour. Our king, being ready to leap out of

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: himself for joy of his found daughter, as if that

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: joy were now become a loss, cries 'O, thy mother,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: thy mother!' then asks Bohemia forgiveness; then

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: embraces his son-in-law; then again worries he his

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: daughter with clipping her; now he thanks the old

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: shepherd, which stands by like a weather-bitten

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: conduit of many kings' reigns. I never heard of such

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: another encounter, which lames report to follow it

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: and undoes description to do it.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: What, pray you, became of Antigonus, that carried

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: hence the child?

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Like an old tale still, which will have matter to

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: rehearse, though credit be asleep and not an ear

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: open. He was torn to pieces with a bear: this

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: avouches the shepherd's son; who has not only his

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: innocence, which seems much, to justify him, but a

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: handkerchief and rings of his that Paulina knows.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: What became of his bark and his followers?

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Wrecked the same instant of their master's death and

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: in the view of the shepherd: so that all the

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: instruments which aided to expose the child were

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: even then lost when it was found. But O, the noble

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: combat that 'twixt joy and sorrow was fought in

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Paulina! She had one eye declined for the loss of

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: her husband, another elevated that the oracle was

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: fulfilled: she lifted the princess from the earth,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: and so locks her in embracing, as if she would pin

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: her to her heart that she might no more be in danger

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: of losing.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: The dignity of this act was worth the audience of

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: kings and princes; for by such was it acted.

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: One of the prettiest touches of all and that which

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: angled for mine eyes, caught the water though not

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: the fish, was when, at the relation of the queen's

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: death, with the manner how she came to't bravely

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: confessed and lamented by the king, how

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: attentiveness wounded his daughter; till, from one

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: sign of dolour to another, she did, with an 'Alas,'

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: I would fain say, bleed tears, for I am sure my

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: heart wept blood. Who was most marble there changed

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: colour; some swooned, all sorrowed: if all the world

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: could have seen 't, the woe had been universal.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Are they returned to the court?

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: No: the princess hearing of her mother's statue,

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: which is in the keeping of Paulina,--a piece many

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: years in doing and now newly performed by that rare

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: Italian master, Julio Romano, who, had he himself

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: eternity and could put breath into his work, would

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: beguile Nature of her custom, so perfectly he is her

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: ape: he so near to Hermione hath done Hermione that

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: they say one would speak to her and stand in hope of

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: answer: thither with all greediness of affection

speaker: Third Gentleman
text_entry: are they gone, and there they intend to sup.

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: I thought she had some great matter there in hand;

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: for she hath privately twice or thrice a day, ever

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: since the death of Hermione, visited that removed

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: house. Shall we thither and with our company piece

speaker: Second Gentleman
text_entry: the rejoicing?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Who would be thence that has the benefit of access?

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: every wink of an eye some new grace will be born:

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: our absence makes us unthrifty to our knowledge.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Let's along.

speaker: First Gentleman
text_entry: Exeunt Gentlemen

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Now, had I not the dash of my former life in me,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: would preferment drop on my head. I brought the old

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: man and his son aboard the prince: told him I heard

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: them talk of a fardel and I know not what: but he

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: at that time, overfond of the shepherd's daughter,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: so he then took her to be, who began to be much

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: sea-sick, and himself little better, extremity of

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: weather continuing, this mystery remained

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: undiscovered. But 'tis all one to me; for had I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: been the finder out of this secret, it would not

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: have relished among my other discredits.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Enter Shepherd and Clown

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Here come those I have done good to against my will,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: and already appearing in the blossoms of their fortune.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Come, boy; I am past moe children, but thy sons and

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: daughters will be all gentlemen born.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: You are well met, sir. You denied to fight with me

speaker: Clown
text_entry: this other day, because I was no gentleman born.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: See you these clothes? say you see them not and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: think me still no gentleman born: you were best say

speaker: Clown
text_entry: these robes are not gentlemen born: give me the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: lie, do, and try whether I am not now a gentleman born.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: I know you are now, sir, a gentleman born.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Ay, and have been so any time these four hours.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: And so have I, boy.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: So you have: but I was a gentleman born before my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: father; for the king's son took me by the hand, and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: called me brother; and then the two kings called my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: father brother; and then the prince my brother and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the princess my sister called my father father; and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: so we wept, and there was the first gentleman-like

speaker: Clown
text_entry: tears that ever we shed.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: We may live, son, to shed many more.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Ay; or else 'twere hard luck, being in so

speaker: Clown
text_entry: preposterous estate as we are.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: I humbly beseech you, sir, to pardon me all the

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: faults I have committed to your worship and to give

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: me your good report to the prince my master.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Prithee, son, do; for we must be gentle, now we are

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: gentlemen.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Thou wilt amend thy life?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: Ay, an it like your good worship.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Give me thy hand: I will swear to the prince thou

speaker: Clown
text_entry: art as honest a true fellow as any is in Bohemia.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: You may say it, but not swear it.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Not swear it, now I am a gentleman? Let boors and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: franklins say it, I'll swear it.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: How if it be false, son?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: If it be ne'er so false, a true gentleman may swear

speaker: Clown
text_entry: it in the behalf of his friend: and I'll swear to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the prince thou art a tall fellow of thy hands and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that thou wilt not be drunk; but I know thou art no

speaker: Clown
text_entry: tall fellow of thy hands and that thou wilt be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: drunk: but I'll swear it, and I would thou wouldst

speaker: Clown
text_entry: be a tall fellow of thy hands.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text_entry: I will prove so, sir, to my power.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Ay, by any means prove a tall fellow: if I do not

speaker: Clown
text_entry: wonder how thou darest venture to be drunk, not

speaker: Clown
text_entry: being a tall fellow, trust me not. Hark! the kings

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and the princes, our kindred, are going to see the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: queen's picture. Come, follow us: we'll be thy

speaker: Clown
text_entry: good masters.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exeunt
